name: dative
content:

Add to word list
the form of a noun, pronoun, or adjective that in some languages marks the indirect object of a verb that has two objects

relating to the dative: the dative case Swedish pronouns have an additional object form, derived from the old dative form.
More examplesFewer examplesThe dative case is quite rare.The loss of dative case endings in spoken Greek had happened by the 1st century AD.The feminine dative ending is determined by phonological factors.

grammar having or relating to the case (= form) of a noun, pronoun, or adjective used to show that a word is the indirect object of a verb that has two objects
